issueDTO.title: Support `jars.extra.classpath` in the Manifest editory to avoid confusion with `additional.bundles`
issueDTO.description:
Currently there is no UI support for `jars.extra.classpath` in the Manifest editor and du to its prominent placing people instead use often `additional.bundles` to add something that should be there for compile but not imported ([what serves a different purpose](https://help.eclipse.org/latest/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.pde.doc.user%2Fguide%2Ftools%2Feditors%2Fmanifest_editor%2Feditor.htm)) [leading to confusion](https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/issues/1403).

Even though `jars.extra.classpath` theoretically supports different styles, we should only support the form where one can specify a single bundle `platform:/plugin/<Bundle-SymbolicName>` as this is also supported by Tycho and easy to adapt by other tools.
comments:
This is a good idea.

I'm not suggesting one needs to make things more complicated so this is just an FYI...

The scheme generally supports
```
platform:/plugins/<bsn>_<version>/
```
as parsed by `org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformURLConnection.parse(String)`.

> The scheme generally supports

Officially also relative path is supported as well as inner jars:

> extra classpaths used to perform automated build. Classpath can either be relative paths, or platform urls referring to plug-ins and fragments of your development environment (e.g. ../someplugin/xyz.jar, platform:/plugins/org.apache.ant/ant.jar). Platform urls are recommended over relative paths;

I just think that if one really requires a version or relative path one can do it manually, but e.g additional bundles do only support a BSN and people seem happy with that already (but using it for a different purpose).
I 100% agree to keep this simple for the common case!
I'm working on this.

> I'm working on this.

Great. You are one of the students from CodeDays, aren't you?

Much success on this task and don't hesitate to ask for help if you need any.

Thank you, yes I am from CodeDay. I wanted to reach out for clarification. In build configuration I am able to add jars by using Extra ClassPath Entries and using the add Jars feature, is there anything specific you wanted on top of having this available in the build section?

> In build configuration I am able to add jars by using Extra ClassPath Entries and using the add Jars feature, is there anything specific you wanted on top of having this available in the build section?

Indeed there is already some UI support in the `Build` section:
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6211ccc8-a9ee-4cc8-807e-514d5e0f6445)

And it even seems to handle relative and 'absolute' URLs properly already.

So maybe we should just move it to the `Dependencies` section, maybe below the `Automated Management of Dependencies` to make it more visible?
@laeubi or @merks any remarks from your side?
Do what you think best.

> Indeed there is already some UI support in the Build section

I never noticed that, its interesting how many features PDE has people often just don't recognize :-D

> So maybe we should just move it to the Dependencies section, maybe below the Automated Management of Dependencies to make it more visible?

I think the first thing should be to make it **expanded by default** currently it is simply to easy to overlook, beside from that I think it makes sense to have it in the "build" section because it is related to the `build.properties`.

Next I think we should add a link in the description of the "Automated Management of Dependencies" with a link that jumps to that tab, that should be enough for people to discover it, if we then also add a N&N entry for that change it should be enough.

> And it even seems to handle relative and 'absolute' URLs properly already.

I think it currently does not work as expected (for me), e.g. it only allows to add *inner jars* from workspace projects, it should also allow to add bundles (either from workspace or target platform) so that needs to be improved to be useful.

If we then have a way to even mark some of them as test-only that would probably already help with  
- https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/pull/914

but that's a different topic of course.

> > So maybe we should just move it to the Dependencies section, maybe below the Automated Management of Dependencies to make it more visible?
> 
> I think the first thing should be to make it **expanded by default** currently it is simply to easy to overlook, beside from that I think it makes sense to have it in the "build" section because it is related to the `build.properties`.

With https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/pull/1469, the section is now expanded by default, thanks to @anviik.

Great so next step would be that it allows to select **any bundle** from the target platform, if that is in place we should  add this to the N&N to make people more aware about this "new" way of specify compile only dependencies.
Hello, my name is Keith and I am from CodeDay. Me and my team will be working on this issue.

issueDTO.title: Generated names are extremely long, as opposed to some organization that would be easier to use
issueDTO.description:
## Bug Report

Shorter schema names from generated code.

### 1. Minimal reproduce step (Required)

```
git@github.com:argoproj/argo-workflows.git
kcl import -m crd -o lib -s ./argo-workflows/manifests/base/crds/full/argoproj.io_clusterworkflowtemplates.yaml
```

### 2. What did you expect to see? (Required)

shorter schema names, organized 

### 3. What did you see instead (Required)

```
schema ArgoprojIoV1alpha1ClusterWorkflowTemplateSpecAffinityNodeAffinityPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionItems0PreferenceMatchFieldsItems0
```

### 4. What is your KCL components version? (Required)

```
kcl --version
kcl version 0.9.6
```
comments: if there was a KCL generator for Go types, instead of OpenAPI or CRDs, then the same organization in the Go code could be ported over. Leaving shorter names.

Yes, we can organize names by package names instead of long schema names. In fact, KCL import OpenAPI has been organized by package name, just like the k8s package https://github.com/kcl-lang/modules/tree/main/k8s/1.31,  through the swagger file https://github.com/kcl-lang/modules/blob/main/scripts/k8s/processed-swagger.json

I looked at the `argo-workflow` module (which I think is also misnamed, should be `argo-workflows`), and I went through a time-boxed 30m exercise to clean it up. I found that a lot of the fields used are actually types coming straight from `k8s` but are instead inlined in that module. In that 30m, I was able to reduce this file (https://github.com/kcl-lang/modules/blob/main/argo-workflow/v1alpha1/argoproj_io_v1alpha1_workflow.k) from 3.37MB to 2.7MB just by fixing references to schemas upstream, but there was a lot more that I could do. I used this as my primary source of information: https://github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows/blob/main/pkg/apis/workflow/v1alpha1/workflow_types.go

This leads me to believe that a potentially better way to generate schemas is by looking at/parsing Go. Anyways, just some shower thoughts.

Thank you! @wmcnamee-coreweave PRs welcome! 

For Go struct to KCL module, track issue is here. https://github.com/kcl-lang/kcl-go/issues/332

Actually, this work is underway and I have successfully converted some of the argoworkflows go code. There are still some errors that need to be fixed.
@Peefy Is this still open to work on?

repository.description: KCL Programming Language (CNCF Sandbox Project). https://kcl-lang.io
repository.name: kcl

summary.main: Generated names are extremely long, as opposed to some organization that would be easier to use, making it difficult to work with the KCL programming language. The issue can be reproduced by running the command `kcl import -m crd -o lib -s ./argo-workflows/manifests/base/crds/full/argoproj.io_clusterworkflowtemplates.yaml` and observing the generated schema name.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for generated names to be shorter and more organized, similar to some other organization. This is a significant issue that affects the usability of the KCL programming language.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue can be addressed by implementing a KCL generator for Go types, instead of OpenAPI or CRDs, to port the same organization from the Go code. Alternatively, names can be organized by package names instead of long schema names, as seen in the k8s package. The issue is currently being worked on, with some progress made in converting some of the argoworkflows Go code, but there are still some errors that need to be fixed.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'help wanted', 'enhancement', 'good first issue', and 'tool', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. The expected behavior is for generated names to be shorter and more organized, similar to some other organization. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with relevant changes and descriptions of the changes made.

issueDTO.title: wrap `data` to support datatype names with no parentheses
issueDTO.description:
I would like to be able to write

```
(data Nat
  (zero)
  (suc Nat))
```

instead of

```
(data (Nat)
  (zero)
  (suc (Nat)))
```

Currently, `stdlib/builtins.kl` defines the appropriate wrappers so that we can write `(the Bool (true))` instead of `(the (Bool) (true)`. It would be nice if that syntax was supported out of the box for user-defined datatypes as well. This sounds easy to implement, by defining a Prelude `data` macro wrapping the kernel's `data` macro.
comments: In this ticket, I am specifically not asking about supporting `(true)` instead of `true`, because I know that the parentheses-free syntax is not supported in patterns. I think the parentheses-free syntax should be fine in `type-case` patterns because we already have many primitive types which don't need parentheses.

repository.description: an implementation of stuck macros
repository.name: klister

summary.main: The issue is about supporting datatype names with no parentheses in the `data` macro, which would simplify the syntax and make it more user-friendly. This feature is currently not supported out of the box for user-defined datatypes, but is available for primitive types.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the `data` macro to support datatype names with no parentheses, allowing users to write code in a more concise and readable format.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by defining a Prelude `data` macro wrapping the kernel's `data` macro in `stdlib/builtins.kl`. This should support user-defined datatypes with no parentheses.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue' and 'stdlib', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with a detailed description of the fix.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Longhornctl / CLI -  no configuration has been provided, try setting KUBERNETES_MASTER environment variable
issueDTO.description:
After Setting up fresh cluster of Microk8s on Baremetal with Ubuntu 24.04 and installing all dependencies I tried to use longhornctl to verify setup.

After following section [Using Longhorn CLI](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.7.2/deploy/install/#using-the-longhorn-command-line-tool) I do have an error:

```
 ./longhornctl check preflight
INFO[2024-12-29T17:00:45+01:00] Initializing preflight checker
W1229 17:00:45.003474  130036 client_config.go:659] Neither --kubeconfig nor --master was specified.  Using the inClusterConfig.  This might not work.
W1229 17:00:45.003482  130036 client_config.go:664] error creating inClusterConfig, falling back to default config: unable to load in-cluster configuration, KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST and KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT must be defined
ERRO[2024-12-29T17:00:45+01:00] Failed to initialize preflight checker: invalid configuration: no configuration has been provided, try setting KUBERNETES_MASTER environment variable
```

I can reproduce this error on all setups. - fresh re-installation, different hosts.

Env:
 - Longhorn version: 1.7.2
 - Installation method: Curl
 - Kubernetes distro (e.g. RKE/K3s/EKS/OpenShift) and version: MicroK8s v1.31.3 revision 7449
   - Number of control plane nodes in the cluster: 4
   - Number of worker nodes in the cluster: 4 (each as working master)
 - Node config
   - OS type and version:  Ubuntu 24.04
   - Kernel version: 6.8.0-51-generic #52-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu Dec  5 13:09:44 UTC 2024 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
   - CPU per node: 48
   - Memory per node: 512
   - Disk type (e.g. SSD/NVMe/HDD): NVMe
   - Network bandwidth between the nodes (Gbps): 1
 - Underlying Infrastructure (e.g. on AWS/GCE, EKS/GKE, VMWare/KVM, Baremetal): Baremetal

I wanted to use **./longhornctl install preflight** to set up CSI Mount Propagation  - and resolve other error during Helm Deployment
comments:
>  ./longhornctl check preflight
> INFO[2024-12-29T17:00:45+01:00] Initializing preflight checker
> W1229 17:00:45.003474  130036 client_config.go:659] Neither --kubeconfig nor --master was specified.  Using the inClusterConfig.  This might not work.
> W1229 17:00:45.003482  130036 client_config.go:664] error creating inClusterConfig, falling back to default config: unable to load in-cluster configuration, KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST and KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT must be defined

The error is straightforward. You need to have the kube cluster client info via env or command options and then run the command. 

@c3y1huang check if we need to improve the doc to make instructions clear if needed.

I've hit the same problem. I've managed to use `--kube-config` which gets rid of some errors about `KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST` and `KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT`, but I still get an error about `KUBERNETES_MASTER` not being defined and I can't find any documentation saying what the value should be. 

Without `--kube-config`:

```
$ longhornctl check preflight
INFO[2025-01-02T11:23:03Z] Initializing preflight checker
W0102 11:23:03.344540 1117544 client_config.go:659] Neither --kubeconfig nor --master was specified.  Using the inClusterConfig.  This might not work.
W0102 11:23:03.344574 1117544 client_config.go:664] error creating inClusterConfig, falling back to default config: unable to load in-cluster configuration, KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST and KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT must be defined
ERRO[2025-01-02T11:23:03Z] Failed to initialize preflight checker: invalid configuration: no configuration has been provided, try setting KUBERNETES_MASTER environment variable
```

With `--kube-config`:

```
$ longhornctl --kube-config /etc/rancher/k3s/config.yaml check preflight
INFO[2025-01-02T11:23:19Z] Initializing preflight checker
ERRO[2025-01-02T11:23:19Z] Failed to initialize preflight checker: invalid configuration: no configuration has been provided, try setting KUBERNETES_MASTER environment variable
```

@beezly  I had the same behaviour with a freshly installed k3s server. 
I just exported KUBECONFIG before running the command. 
For k3s:
```
export KUBECONFIG=/etc/rancher/k3s/k3s.yaml
```
Then everything works fine.

> The error is straightforward. You need to have the kube cluster client info via env or command options and then run the command.

This was not a useful comment sir. 

The error  _erroneously_ states  "Neither --kubeconfig nor --master was specified.  Using the inClusterConfig.  This might not work."  


There's a typo in that help. The proper flag is  **--kube-config**      Furthermore,  none of these help commands provide the proper flag to specify the cluster config. 

   longhornctl --help
   longhornctl check --help
   longhornctl check preflight --help
This issue is stale because it has been open for 30 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days.

Hello @jdblack 
This enhancement is scheduled for a later release. Any contributions are appreciated. Thanks.

> Hello [@jdblack](https://github.com/jdblack) This enhancement is scheduled for a later release. Any contributions are appreciated. Thanks.

Thanks @derekbit,  though  this isn't my issue (I believe  it was filed by @MateuszBeru).     I was just  clarifying  for @innobead that the situation was not as straightforward as he claimed, as the documentation was  incorrect .


By the way, thank you very much for Longhorn. It's a great tool!

issueDTO.title: Confusing SWT Style Bits in CSS Spy
issueDTO.description:
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/assets/44021373/996918d4-5498-4737-8e74-0b244809668a)

The **CSS Rules** section of **CSS Spy** shows the current **SWT Style Bits** for the selected control, but it seems to contain a lot of useless information, such as styles that are not currently supported by the selected control (e.g. `SWT.RADIO` here), and bits that are not styles (e.g. `SWT.ERROR_MENU_NOT_POP_UP` here). -> Good first issue

issueDTO.title: Add Probe Subset Strategy Option
issueDTO.description:
This is a feature request to track a potential PR to implement it. I'm also looking for feedback for both naming and implementation preference.

Users can currently speed up Target Quality by only encoding down to only 1/4 of the frames in a chunk by specifying `--probing-rate 2..4`. We'll call this current behavior the "rate" strategy. We find this strategy acceptable because we consider that not all frames in a scene/chunk are necessary to accurately probe it and the speed-accuracy tradeoff is worth it. With that in mind, I propose a different strategy for reducing the computation in Target Quality probing: the "subset" strategy. This strategy would probe only the middle N frames in a chunk. Users can specify the number of frames to probe with `--probe-strategy subset --probing-subset N`. So for a given chunk of 400 frames, users can specify `--probing-subset 50` to probe only 50 frames in the middle.

It's possible to implement both strategies simultaneously but for simplicity we can only support just one strategy at a time. For now, I initially propose 2 new options: `--probe-strategy` (or alternatively `--probe-type`) and `--probing-subset <INT>`. The value for `--probe-stategy` can be `rate` or `subset` and defaults to `rate` to match the current behavior. `--probing-rate <INT>` will be ignored when using `--probe-strategy subset` and vice-versa for `--probing-subset <INT>` and `--probe-strategy rate` (default).

I understand there are valid reasons to avoid using subsets in Target Quality mode, but I have had satisfactory results with this strategy in my own custom reimplementation of Target Quality and would like to see it implemented in the core product as an optional feature. I personally use ~20 frames per chunk so it's significantly faster than 1/4 of a very long chunk.

Thanks,
\- Boats M.

The current behavior can be matched by setting the default value of `--probe-strategy` to `rate`.

issueDTO.title: Disable all Kando shortcuts while simulating hotkeys
issueDTO.description:
### Description

I’ve set up a pie menu system with the following keybindings:

    Shift + A → Opens Pie Menu 1 (with its own set of buttons/items)

    Ctrl + A → Opens Pie Menu 2 (with its own set of buttons/items)

Now, when I open Pie Menu 1 using Shift + A, there's a button inside labeled "Select All", which is assigned the hotkey Ctrl + A—a common shortcut for that action.

The problem: when I trigger "Select All" within Pie Menu 1 (which sends Ctrl + A), Kando instead interprets this as a global shortcut and opens Pie Menu 2, instead of executing the intended command inside the menu.

While the current behavior—redirecting based on global shortcuts—is logical and consistent, Kando already supports submenus by simply dragging and copying items. Given that, it might be helpful to make this redirection behavior customizable.

Suggestion:
Adding an optional setting to disable pie menu redirection and instead allow the assigned command to execute would be very useful—especially for users who customize many shortcuts or manage complex menu systems.

This would remove unnecessary limitations and offer more flexibility in how users design their workflows.

### Affected Desktop Environments

Windows

### Additional Information

_No response_
comments: Hi there! Thanks for the suggestion. I think this could be possible. If anybody wants to give this a shot, please drop a note here!

issueDTO.title: Add Interface Names in IP and MAC Attributes
issueDTO.description:
### Component(s)

processor/resourcedetection

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.


> In the current implementation of resource detection and metadata providers, `host.ip` and `host.mac` do not include interface name details. However, including this information could be beneficial in certain scenarios.


### Describe the solution you'd like

```
// HostIPs returns the host's IP interfaces
HostIPs() ([]InterfaceIP, error)

// HostMACs returns the host's MAC addresses
HostMACs() ([]InterfaceMAC, error)

type InterfaceIP struct {
	IP            net.IP
	InterfaceName string
}

// Define a new struct for interface MACs
type InterfaceMAC struct {
	MAC           net.HardwareAddr
	InterfaceName string
}
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:

 See [Adding Labels via Comments](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-labels-via-comments) if you do not have permissions to add labels yourself.

Hi, thanks for creating the issue. I agree with the addition of the interface name, but not into the IP or MAC attributes, as I would rather put it in a separate attribute.

Any objections about this?

Thanks

Hi there! I don't have any objections to your approach of putting the interface name in a separate attribute rather than combining it with the IP or MAC attributes
I can make the changes if this approach works fine

host.ip.interfaces
host.mac.interfaces

But how would be able to distinguish interface if it is of **MAC** or is of **IP**

I am not a networking expert, but interfaces (and MAC adresses) are present on L2 layer of TPC/IP model, therefore there is a 1on1 binding between those two. Not sure what do you mean under `interface is of`. Can you please explain this more? 

There is no persistent binding of interface and IP, since considering for example dynamic assignment of IP adresses via DHCP protocol (for example connecting to wifi), this can change.

What actual use case are you trying to solve with this?

issueDTO.title: Add a commandline flag to clear the image cache
issueDTO.description:
### Short Summary

Hey, I hope you are fine!

I am using Kando on different icon themes that, when changed, they replace the old icon files with new ones. The difference is only their color but the design is the same.

Usually, when I have this initial theme with gruvbox color:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a9622e6b-c044-4847-9b16-7f5f30ec06c7)

with the related icon files `blueteam.svg`, you can see it is right.

Now I change my theme and I also replace my icon files, like `blueteam.svg` with red colors (so the existing yellow one will be replaced/deleted). When I do this, and I invoke Kando, Kando still remains with the old non-existing icons (probably because it uses a cache):

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dcc1eb3c-0054-4029-b9a0-f3520c3cbe4e)

I also tried to use `kando --reload menu-theme` but it does not refresh the icons. I'm forced each time to close kando completely and reopen it.


### Kando Version

1.8.0

### Installation Method

Via a package manger

### Desktop Environment

GNOME on X11

### Environment Version

Athena OS (Arch-based) GNOME 48

### Additional Information

_No response_
comments: Hi there! I guess we could add a commandline switch like `--clear-image-cache` which would force Kando to reload all images. This [seems to be possible](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/68204612/how-do-i-clear-local-images-from-electrons-cache-when-using-a-preload-script).

Yes, a new argument like that would be good. Or probably what if you don't add a new argument but just doing the clearing of cache automatically each time the menu is invoked? Or better: is the usage of a cache actually increasing the performance or it is negligible?

Well, I think caching is a good thing even it would not give a measurable performance increase on a specific hardware. People could use significantly slower hard drives, icons can be loaded from network drives or even from the web.

And I think that changing the content of icon files at runtime is a rather rare use-case 😅
@Schneegans I think it should be a "Refresh" buttons. For example, when you select an icon, in that selection window there should be a refresh button.

issueDTO.title: <shift>-<enter> should do an enter but keep user control
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes I want to tell gemini cli: 
"""
Look at this output, this is clearly wrong:

  - gic_migration_2024_06_25: ✅ Assertion passed: Command succeeded.
  - sakura_repo_exists: ✅ Path exists: /Users/ricc/git/sakura
"""

Where the first part (lines 1/2) im typing and the second part (3/4) is the output of some commands i cut pasted.

However, as soon as I press the first eNTER i lose control and gemini cli gets it. We need to have some mechanism to introduce an <ENTER> without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in tyiuping mode.

I suppose SHIFT ENTER is the most natural, but happy to consider others too (or maybe one exists and Im not aware of it)
comments:
I'd support this, and it would be a good first issue for someone interested in contributing.

If no one takes it though then I will.

Heads up, we do support shift-enter on mac if you follow the same steps that Claude asks you to follow to configure your terminal to support it. https://b.corp.google.com/issues/424007249 has more details.
Related: #1699
,take

Just to add, I personally use the Warp Terminal on Mac. By default, Warp allows you to add a new-line using either of the following:

* ⇧ + ↵ Enter
* ⌥ + ↵ Enter

But once you are running Gemini, it doesn't work with either approach.
Thamks for the info on warp. We would really appreciate a pull request to make both of them work  when Gemini Cli is running in warp.

hey @maisyk as per my knowledge warp isnt a terminal on its own, it uses a custom Rust-based UI framework and handles input at the application layer, not via the OS TTY driver

Warp collects keystrokes in its own internal editor, only sending the buffer to the shell on Enter or whatever you configure

so when we use gemini on warp, it is no different than using a gemini on a normal terminal, i hope this helps us understand this issue better

issueDTO.title: [Bug] imagePullSecrets is inmutable
issueDTO.description:
<!--
Bugs should be filed for issues encountered whilst operating mariadb-operator.
Please provide as much detail as possible. 
-->

**Documentation**
- [X] I acknowledge that I have read the relevant [documentation](https://github.com/mariadb-operator/mariadb-operator/tree/main/docs).

**Describe the bug**
Tried to add a credential for the images for my MariaDB resource, got `'spec.imagePullSecrets' field is inmutable`

**Expected behaviour**
One should be able to add or change the pull credentials.

**Environment details**:
- Kubernetes version: 1.32.3
- Kubernetes distribution: k3s
- MariaDB Operator version: 0.38.1
- MariaDB Server version: 11.5
- Install method: Helm
comments: Thanks @codestation ! Indeed, this should be mutable. Contributions welcomed!
This issue is stale because it has been open 60 days with no activity.

repository.description: 🦭 Run and operate MariaDB in a cloud native way
repository.name: mariadb-operator

summary.main: The 'spec.imagePullSecrets' field in the MariaDB resource is currently immutable, preventing users from adding or changing the pull credentials. This issue needs to be fixed to allow for flexible image pull secret management.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the 'spec.imagePullSecrets' field to be mutable, enabling users to manage their image pull secrets as needed.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by making the 'spec.imagePullSecrets' field mutable, allowing users to add or change the pull credentials.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'stale', 'bug', 'help wanted', and 'good first issue', indicating it's an open issue that has been inactive for 60 days with no activity. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with a fix for the issue.

issueDTO.title: Move current docs to myst
issueDTO.description:
Move any sections of the docs to myst using rst-myst command line tool. 

- Make the PR from stable
- Install  [rst2myst](https://rst-to-myst.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) with uvx since its requirements are not up to date so it will downgrade your sphinx if you install it in the project environment.
- Use to convert 1 file (for example contrib.rst)
- Fix typos.
-  Make PR for that 1 file. If you are planing on helping out will multiple sections, then submit 1 or 2, and I will review them and then you can do more. Because the rst2myst does make mistakes, the reviewer(probably me) needs to click on every link and check carefully line by line.  

Just add a comment to what section you are working on. 

An unfortunate downside is that the git blame will be reset for the docs files. 

The index.rst file needs to be the last file converted since I cannot figure out to have rst files and a md file as the index.  See [myst docs](https://myst-parser.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax/roles-and-directives.html#roles-directivesl) for how to use myst with sphinx roles.  We have a custom roles that will need eval-rst. Check other docs already created for examples and [click-extra docs](https://kdeldycke.github.io/click-extra/sphinx.html#click-directives) for how the roles work.
comments: I did a PR for the Why document. #2949  I can work reverse alphabetical as the PRs are accepted. Next would be wincmd.rst then virtualenv.rst and so on.
Sounds good.

@Veebaa That would be helpful. Thanks.
Hi guys, I'm working on click-concepts.rst, is anyone else working on it?
I am going to start working on documentation.rst, let me know if anyone else is working on it.

Let me know if you are happy for me to carry on with some more now 😄
@Veebaa No problem. You are good to keep going; let's just do one at a time.

issueDTO.title: English string change suggestions
issueDTO.description:
App

"Select Source" —> "Select source"

"Apply version string extraction Regex to entire page" —> "Apply the version string extraction regular expression to the entire page"

"Version string extraction RegEx" —> "Version string extraction regular expression"


README and wiki

Make them sentence case

"Package ID" —> "Package name"

Issue templates

"Suggest a new Source, setting, or other feature" —> "Suggest a new source, setting, or other feature"

"1. It is not already possible to use the HTML Source for your purposes." —> "1. It is not already possible to use the HTML source for your purposes."

"The App version (or any release-specific identifier - a "pseudo-version") for the latest release" —> "The app version (or any release-specific identifier - a "pseudo-version") for the latest release"

"Note that the Web scraper cannot deal with JavaScript-enabled content." —> 'Note that the web scraper cannot deal with JavaScript-enabled content."

"Note that app-specific Sources are less likely to be added. In those cases, see if the HTML Source will work for you (if not, see if a generally-applicable enhancement to the HTML Source would work, and suggest that instead)." —> Note that app-specific Sources are less likely to be added. In those cases, see if the HTML Source will work for you (if not, see if a generally-applicable enhancement to the HTML Source would work, and suggest that instead)." —> "Note that app-specific sources are less likely to be added. In those cases, see if the HTML source will work for you (if not, see if a generally-applicable enhancement to the HTML source would work, and suggest that instead)."

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request] ability to configure criteria to save best model
issueDTO.description:
Currently, the Task Runner will save the best model based on the accuracy score acquired during aggregated model validation. A higher accuracy score indicates better performance ([ref](https://github.com/securefederatedai/openfl/blob/develop/openfl/component/aggregator/aggregator.py#L1154)). This is good practice in general, but is limited to metrics where higher score indicates better performance. There will be cases where a user will use a loss metric for validation. In this case, lower values indicate better performance and the Task Runner will not save the best model since it is looking for the highest value.

This configuration should be via the enabled via `plan.yaml`
A natural location to consider would be the `task_*.yaml` ([ref](https://github.com/securefederatedai/openfl/blob/develop/openfl-workspace/workspace/plan/defaults/tasks_torch.yaml#L6))

repository.description: An Open Framework for Federated Learning.
repository.name: openfl

summary.main: The Task Runner currently saves the best model based on the accuracy score, but this may not be suitable for all users. The ability to configure the criteria for saving the best model would provide more flexibility and control for users, and would allow them to use the Task Runner in a more effective and efficient way.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the Task Runner to allow users to configure the criteria for saving the best model, so that users can choose the metric that best suits their needs. This requirement is necessary to ensure that the Task Runner is flexible and adaptable to different use cases.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding a configuration option in the `plan.yaml` file to allow users to specify the criteria for saving the best model. This option can be set to either 'accuracy' or 'loss' depending on the user's preference. The Task Runner can then be modified to use this configuration option when saving the best model.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'enhancement' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with clear documentation of the configuration options and their effects.

issueDTO.title: Who is Using Nightingale | Share your experience and best practices in using Nightingale
issueDTO.description:
可以通过在当前 issue 登记您的使用情况，并分享您使用夜莺监控的经验，将会自动进入 **[END USERS](https://github.com/ccfos/nightingale/blob/main/doc/end-users.md)** 列表，并获得社区的 **VIP Support**。

> 示例

- 企业或者组织: 夜莺
- 地点：北京
- 使用场景和经验分享：你们最看重夜莺的哪些功能，解决一个什么样的问题，以及使用规模和范围，使用夜莺监控构建企业级监控体系的过程中，有哪些好的经验分享。
- 需求建议：希望哪些点上夜莺监控能做的更好，更契合您的使用场景。
comments:
- 企业或者组织: 中移动
- 地点：北京
- 使用场景：可视化监控报警配置
- 需求建议：急需巡检报表，可根据主机，监控项导出报表

> 

你这么大的企业,付费吧,别跟我们抢开源了

- 企业或者组织: inke
- 地点：北京
- 使用场景和经验分享：
- 最看重夜莺的哪些功能：
  1.更契合云原生场景。
  2.能节约大量成本。目前用的open-falcon, falcon-graph对disk.io和mem需求太高。使用n9e可以节约70%的成本。
  3.更灵活的告警配置，更多聚合算法。
- 使用规模和范围：
  使用规模：目前vm中的series数量有4亿+，实际应该是2亿+（之前为业务组打上标签导致很多指标重新上报了）。
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3918461/163515994-2d11ff27-73f8-47c0-913c-c3ac1d41106e.png)

- 架构：简单抽象为3个机房。国内有A,B机房，国外C机房。
  - A机房部署thanos，采样之后保存历史数据。
  - B机房部署VictoriaMetrics，提供3个月原始数据。
  - C机房部署Prometheus，量比较小。

  - 使用了telegraf采集基础监控，业务监控暂时通过falcon的/v1/push接口转发至n9e,后期下掉falcon由sdk直接上报。
  - telegraf加壳部署为n9e-agent,每个机器都往各自机房server写数据。
  - A,B机房的数据双写(集群：Default)，读写地址是通过srv域名做的区域解析。A区的server读自己的TSDB(thanos)，B区的server读(B机房部署VictoriaMetrics，提供3个月原始数据)。

- TSDB:
  - 时序存储测试了thanos,VictoriaMetrics,m3db。m3db因资源占用太高被下掉了。
  - m3db: m3 Coordinator节点经常oom,扩容到5台*256G的内存都不行，换了vm 5台128G的机器还有50%空闲。
  - thanos: 用的Receive模式，保存3个月原始数据，历史数据会采样之后上传到oss,压力主要在receive服务。
    > thanos有个问题：query无法按时间就近查询receive,而是查询所有store地址然后合并数据(是否我的用法不当)？假如receive存7天数据，store存30天数据，我只想查最近7天的数据，他会同时查询receive和store,因为store数据可能保存在oss所以会很慢。为了解决查询速度慢的问题，加了query-frontend,store地址也合并为1个lb地址，初次查询会慢，后面就走缓存了。
  - VictoriaMetrics：vm我测试下来挺满意的，目前用了8台机器，总体资源使用不足40%。

- 需求建议：可以更易用，当然这个是大家共同探索的方向。

> @bbaobelief 请教几个问题 1、业务监控暂时通过falcon的/v1/push接口转发至n9e(将原来agent推送到transfer的压力都转发到n9e,为什么不考虑直接推送到vm或者Prometheus).后期下掉falcon由sdk直接上报(这块agent聚合能力放到sdk去处理吗？还是采取一分钟推送一次？感觉这块逻辑放到sdk是否会影响原来应用的资源使用) 2、之前falcon的nodata处理你们有遇到这块的问题嘛？

- 问题 1
  - 写n9e-server是为了配置多个远程写，还有n9e-server有ident注册逻辑，自动按业务组打标签功能。目前观察n9e-server没啥压力。
  - 我们现有的框架sdk是计算好之后1分钟上报一次falcon,为了n9e能快速上线，减少业务代码改动，用了falcon-agent转发n9e-server。
- 问题 2
  - nodata目前没有太好的方案。对于一些精确labels使用了`absent_over_time `函数告警。

- 企业或者组织: 方正证券
- 地点：北京
- 使用场景和经验分享：
- 最看重夜莺的哪些功能：
	* 云原生监控，无缝对接Prometheus的能力，支持多种、多个数据源
	* 开源、活跃的社区、有问必答的专业监控咨询，构建了一个比较好的监控生态圈，能放心使用
	* 从Open-Falcon到夜莺，监控组件一直很稳定
	* 更有效的告警策略配置
	* 完善的监控数据查询、监控大盘构建能力
	* 按业务线进行读、写权限控制
- 使用规模和范围：
	* 测试环境监控对象接入1500+,生产环境监控对象接入近6000台
	* 测试环境监控策略700+项,生产环境监控策略3300+项
- 架构：目前是在同时使用Open-falcon和夜莺监控系统
    * 6机房，保留Open-falcon监控系统：Transfer组件转发到中心Transfer
    * 主机房夜莺server、webapi按官方推荐，根据需求多节点部署
    * agent：历史监控一直使用Open-falcon，涉及agent较多，且falcon-agent的适配和稳定性较好，采用夜莺facon push接口，进行数据同步；K8S使用grafana-agent采集；telegraf根据需求进行部署，进一步推广
    * 监控数据：中心Transfer 同步到夜莺；默认采用Prometheus TSDB，接入多个研发、运维的Prometheus数据源；VictoriaMetrics作为长期存储
- 需求建议：
	 * 管控能力，更少的人管理更多的监控
	 * 更容易上手，降低研发、运维等使用门槛
	 * agent管理：状态、部署、更新、命令下发等能力
	 * 插件或工具的管理及流程化

最后特别感谢夜莺监控团队对监控领域的辛勤付出和耐心解答！

> 

企业或者组织: 深圳艾派
地点：西安
使用场景：可视化监控报警配置
需求建议：app或者小程序

企业或者组织: 人人公司
地点：北京
使用场景：可视化监控报警配置，日志监控，对接K8S ，做多集群prometheus 存储
需求建议：日志mtail 本身是日志告警的，有个组件叫loggie ，做日志告警以及日志收集，看是否可以整合，两个开源团队能否碰触火花

企业或者组织: 诺瓦星云科技股份有限公司
地点：西安
使用场景：主要是监控VMware云的虚机，做可视化监控报警配置，应用日志监控，多集群prometheus 存储。
需求建议：可一边使用快捷查询，一边可提示语法方式制作、测试监控模板。碰到过好多，告警模板制作好了，许久没有告警。

最重要的是，作为一个监控系统，虽然不做大而全，但至少能提供一个批量处理集群的命令执行工具。比如ansible能集成就好了。

祝发展越来越好。

- 企业或者组织: 路特斯
- 地点：武汉
- 使用场景和经验分享：
- 最看重夜莺的哪些功能：
  - 云原生监控，无缝对接Prometheus，grafana能力，支持多种、多个数据源
  - 开源、活跃的社区、有问必答的专业监控咨询，构建了一个比较好的监控生态圈，能放心使用
  - 灵活的告警策略配置，以及告警记录回溯能力
  - 企业级 SSO 无缝集成能力，按业务线，团队管理能力
- 使用场景：
  - 目前主要使用夜莺告警管理能力，以及和自研应用集成, 监控对象持续接入中
- 架构：目前是在同时使用kube-promethues和夜莺监控系统
  - 混合云：每个机房kube-promethues，夜莺server 进行部署
  - 主机房夜莺server、webapi按官方推荐，根据需求多节点部署
  - agent：使用grafana-agent 进行数据采集，telegraf 探索中
  - 监控数据：同步到夜莺server；各个机房采用Prometheus TSDB，每个机房单独的一台grafana做历史可视化查看；VictoriaMetrics作为长期存储
- 需求建议：
  - k8s 中服务监控告警集成能力支持，降低研发、运维等使用门槛
  - 告警收敛能力，告警风暴避免的方案
  - 电话告警能力支持

企业或者组织: 西安轻网
地点：西安
使用场景和经验分享：
使用k8s进行部署夜莺，categraf作为采集器采集数据。
最看重夜莺的哪些功能：
集采集器、告警、平台展示于一体，开箱即用。而且都是开源项目，可以从中学到很多东西。
使用场景：
使用k8s部署夜莺的nwebapi和nserver，categraf负责采集数据推送到nserver
需求建议：
1.在页面上支持对categraf采集器的配置，并可以通过配置内容反向查询agent
2.helm部署夜莺暴露nserver
3.活跃告警、历史告警列表支持从外部接入告警信息进行展示

企业或者组织: 分秒帧
地点：北京
使用场景和经验分享：

最看重夜莺的哪些功能：
云原生监控，无缝对接Prometheus，grafana能力，支持多种、多个数据源
开源、活跃的社区、有问必答的专业监控咨询，构建了一个比较好的监控生态圈，以及强大的 agent [Categraf](https://github.com/flashcatcloud/categraf)，丰富多彩的中间件插件。可以一键式接入监控平台。
使用场景：
目前主要使用夜莺告警管理能力，以及和自研微服务框架集成, 因为服务发现使用的 etcd，所以不能复用 Prometheus 已有实现 pull 发现，采用框架定时器 push 到  [Categraf](https://github.com/flashcatcloud/categraf)，然后  [Categraf](https://github.com/flashcatcloud/categraf) 再 push 到夜莺 server。
需求建议：
- 开源版本增加日志告警功能
- 增加告警升级功能，防止某个团队没人值班告警被忽略
- 企业版本增加排班功能等
- agent 增加 etcd 发现 pull 模式
- webbook 报警内容增加报警时刻的图表截图

企业或者组织: 云算时代
地点：厦门

使用场景和经验分享：
·从open falcon开始接触
·由于人力和规模情况；当前是v3的最终版本，等社区v6上线后准备迭代到v5的最终版本
·M3其实不适合每个公司，内存消耗大，而且原生对接会跳过一个调度器的组件，如果不是开箱的话，会带来一定的工量摸索
·结合Prometheus Thanos 对象存储做了一些冷热数据分离归档的调整
·使用的历代版本都有很大的工量投入在自定义上报功能订制
·说句无关技术的话，带宽和数据量，控本的问题要最开始规划好

最看重夜莺的哪些功能：
其实最看重企业版层层下钻的灭火图

使用场景：
数据量和成本问题有意只开启了一部分metrics，裸机量2k+这样子

需求建议：
实话实说，v2 v3 v4更像是三个产品，各有侧重和优势；v5则是拥抱生态
恳切建议产品经理要认真思考这个问题
或者说一句很外行的话，有没有一种可能做成本体和插件的形式来实现个人需求定制

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Fix nozzle cooling parameter
issueDTO.description:
### Printer model

32b Buddy

### Firmware version

6.3.2

### Upgrades and modifications

_No response_

### Printing from...

any

### Describe the bug

M109 detects parameter 'F' for fast nozzle cooling but it should be 'C' not to conflict with Marlin's autotemp flag.

Just replace
`(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('F'));`
with
`(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('C'));`

Introduced in #4014 but stuck in time.

### How to reproduce

```
M107
M104 S100
M109 R100
M104 S50
M109 R50 C
```

### Expected behavior

Fan should turn on (and off after reaching the final temperature).

### Files

_No response_
comments: Hello, none of our printers have AUTOTEMP enabled, so I'd say this is purely cosmetical. Is this flag emitted by the Slicer? Because if it is, when we cannot just change it.

It's safer to avoid collision. However, Prusa Slicer does not use it so it's a trivial and cosmetical change. Unfortunatelly, it's so simple that nobody cares :-(. But it would be hard once it will be used widely.

Thank you for your contribution to our project. This issue has not received any updates for 60 days and may be considered "stale." If this issue is still important to you, please add an update within the next 7 days to keep it open. Administrators can manually reopen the issue if necessary.

repository.description: Firmware for the Original Prusa MINI, Original Prusa MK4, Original Prusa XL and Prusa CORE One 3D printers by Prusa Research.
repository.name: Prusa-Firmware-Buddy

summary.main: The nozzle cooling parameter in the M109 command is currently set to 'F' instead of 'C', causing issues with the fan not turning on or off correctly. This needs to be fixed to ensure the correct behavior and prevent conflicts with Marlin's autotemp flag.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the fan to turn on (and off after reaching the final temperature) when using the M109 command with the correct parameter 'C' instead of 'F'.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by replacing `(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('F'));` with `(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('C'));` in the firmware code, as suggested in the issue description.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'bug', 'stale-issue', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after changes or code snippets if possible.

issueDTO.title: `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.azure.com/"` fails when signed in using the `-AccessToken` parameter.
issueDTO.description:
### Description

If users sign in using:

```pwsh
Connect-AzAccount -AccessToken
```
then running the following command:
```pwsh
Get-AzAcessToken -ResourceUrl "https//management.azure.com/"
```
will fail with the error:
```pwsh
Get-AzAccessToken: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.
```
However, `Get-AzAcessToken -ResourceUrl "https//management.core.windows.net/"` does work.

Also, if users authenticate using any other method (e.g., interactive, device code) without specifying `-AccessToken`, then both of the following succeed:

```pwsh
Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.azure.com/"
Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.core.windows.net/"
```

The issue seems to be related to https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527.

Could this be an edge case that the `Connect-AzAccount` cmdlet fail to handle?


### Issue script & Debug output

```PowerShell
Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.azure.com/" -Debug
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplaySecretsWarning], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - GetAzureRmAccessTokenCommand begin processing with ParameterSet 'ResourceUrl'.
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - using account id 'shenglol'...
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplayBreakingChangeWarning], Module = [Az.Accounts], Cmdlet = [Get-AzAccessToken]. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisableInstanceDiscovery], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [False].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [EnableErrorRecordsPersistence], Module = [Az.Accounts], Cmdlet = [Get-AzAccessToken]. Returning default value [False].
Get-AzAccessToken: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplayBreakingChangeWarning], Module = [Az.Accounts], Cmdlet = [Get-AzAccessToken]. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplayRegionIdentified], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [CheckForUpgrade], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: AzureQoSEvent:  Module: Az.Accounts:5.1.0; CommandName: Get-AzAccessToken; PSVersion: 7.5.1; IsSuccess: False; Duration: 00:00:00.0081732; SanitizeDuration: 00:00:00; Exception: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.;
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [EnableDataCollection], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - GetAzureRmAccessTokenCommand end processing.
```

### Environment data

```PowerShell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.5.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.5.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.22621
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

### Module versions

```PowerShell
ModuleType Version    PreRelease Name                                ExportedCommands
---------- -------    ---------- ----                                ----------------
Script     5.1.0                 Az.Accounts                         {Add-AzEnvironment, Clear-AzConfig, Clear-AzContext, Clear-AzDefault…}
```

### Error output

```PowerShell
Get-AzAccessToken: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.
```
comments:
Here are some similar issues that might help you. Please check if they can solve your problem.
- #13527
------------

**Possible solution (Extracted from existing issue, might be incorrect; please verify carefully)**

### Solution 1:
Please use `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.core.windows.net/"`, current version doesn't support URL alias yet, it only respects URL from (Get-AzEnvironment).ActiveDirectoryServiceEndpointResourceId, we may do some enhancement later.

**Reference**:
- https://github.com/azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527#issuecomment-729460201
### Solution 2:
"management.core.windows.net" worked, thanks.

**Reference**:
- https://github.com/azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527#issuecomment-729981637

_Powered by [issue-sentinel](https://github.com/Azure/issue-Sentinel)_

The cmdlet first looks up the actual resource URI according to the passed-in URI, the use it to obtain a token.

In the cases of signing in interactively, since there's a refresh token in the cache, no matter which URI is provided it can always obtain an access token silently.

However, when signing in with `-AccessToken`, there's no refresh token, meaning that unless the provided URI is an exact match, it cannot acquire a new token.

This behavior is by design, but we definitely should guide customers to use `-ResourceTypeName` for well-known resources, cause it provides superior accessiblity.

For example

Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceTypeName Arm

For context, we don’t call `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl` directly - it’s invoked by the .NET SDK (see code [here](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/blob/9822a2b5ebb5ad519cad23e58dadaec0269c88d2/sdk/identity/Azure.Identity/src/Credentials/AzurePowerShellCredential.cs#L258)), so we can’t specify `-ResourceTypeName` ourselves.

repository.description: Microsoft Azure PowerShell
repository.name: azure-powershell

summary.main: The `Get-AzAccessToken` cmdlet fails when signing in using the `-AccessToken` parameter with the resource URL `https://management.azure.com/`, resulting in an error message indicating that the access token cannot be retrieved. This issue is related to the design of the cmdlet and the way it handles URL aliases.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the `Get-AzAccessToken` cmdlet to retrieve an access token for the specified resource URL without failing, and for the `Connect-AzAccount` cmdlet to correctly authenticate users when using the `-AccessToken` parameter.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by using `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.core.windows.net/"`, as suggested in issue #13527. This is because the current version of the `Get-AzAccessToken` cmdlet does not support URL aliases yet, and it only respects the URL from `Get-AzEnvironment`.ActiveDirectoryServiceEndpointResourceId. Additionally, the cmdlet first looks up the actual resource URI according to the passed-in URI, and then uses it to obtain a token.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to the `Connect-AzAccount` cmdlet and the `Get-AzAccessToken` cmdlet failing when signing in using the `-AccessToken` parameter, specifically with the resource URL `https://management.azure.com/`. The issue seems to be related to https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527. The expected behavior is for the `Get-AzAccessToken` cmdlet to retrieve an access token for the specified resource URL, but it fails with the error message '[AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.'

issueDTO.title: Generated code for client produces warning under Scala 3.7.x
issueDTO.description: The generated code for client contains implicits passed explicitly which now requires the `using` keyword from Scala 3.7.0 or a warning is triggered. Unfortunately we can't just add that because then the code will not compile under older Scala versions. It seems we need something like the `scala3_sources` in ScalaPB. See similar workaround: https://github.com/scalapb/ScalaPB/pull/1854

repository.description: Functional GraphQL library for Scala
repository.name: caliban

summary.main: The generated code for client contains implicits passed explicitly, which now requires the `using` keyword from Scala 3.7.0 or triggers a warning, and it seems that a workaround similar to the one provided in https://github.com/scalapb/ScalaPB/pull/1854 is needed to address this issue.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the generated code for client to compile under older Scala versions without triggering a warning, while also being compatible with Scala 3.7.x.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by finding a workaround similar to the one provided in https://github.com/scalapb/ScalaPB/pull/1854, which seems to address the issue of implicits passed explicitly in generated code for client under Scala 3.7.x.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'client', 'good first issue', and 'tools', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle.

Thanks.

Hi @adamhill, Thank you for your interest.
This issue it's blocked because we need define what will be the origin of the alerts and how this will be show up to the users, Let me try to unblock this tomorrow and I will release the task.
No hurry. It's the 4th of July weekend in the States and I will be out with the family Thurs thru Monday.

issueDTO.title: `icon` parameters should accept Emoji shortcodes
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

We have a lot of `icon` parameters throughout our codebase. They accept emojis and Material icons, but not emoji shortcodes such as `:warning:`. We should enable that. 

### Why?

In some cases it can be more convenient to pass the shortcode instead of putting the actual emoji into your code. 

### How?

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments:
**To help Streamlit prioritize this feature, react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your vote helps us identify which enhancements matter most to our users.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-10893)
Can I try for this issue? This is my first time contributing code to an open-source project.

@zyc140345 Yes, absolutely, I think this would be a very good issue to work on since it's pretty obvious what we want. Please make sure you have another look which elements have an `icon` parameter and need changes.
Note that this also means `:streamlit:` doesn't work for the `icon` parameter.
We should also do this for the `avatar` parameter of `st.chat_message`.

repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.
repository.name: streamlit

summary.main: The `icon` parameters in the Streamlit codebase currently do not accept emoji shortcodes, such as `:warning:`, which can be inconvenient for users who prefer to pass shortcodes instead of actual emojis.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the `icon` parameters to accept emoji shortcodes, allowing users to pass shortcodes instead of actual emojis into their code, making it more convenient in certain cases.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by modifying the `icon` parameters to accept emoji shortcodes, such as `:warning:`, and ensuring that the changes are applied across all elements with `icon` parameters, including `st.download_button`, `st.success`, `st.set_page_config`, `st.error`, `st.form_submit_button`, `st.info`, `st.chat_message`, `st.link_button`, `st.button`, `st.badge`, `st.warning`, and `st.multipage-apps`.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'enhancement' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable task for a contributor to tackle. The issue is currently open and has received comments from users, including a suggestion to vote with a 👍 to help Streamlit prioritize the feature.

issueDTO.title: [Umbrella] unified parameter class and refactor connector creation logic
issueDTO.description:
### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)


### Search before asking

- [x] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/seatunnel/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3A%22bug%22) and found no similar issues.


### Describe the proposal

This issue has two proposal:

1. move all parameter that user can adjust to a single class, connector use `XXXSourceConfig/ XXXSourceOptions`. 
Update `EnvCommandOptions` to describe the parameters we can adjust in config `env` part.
Update `ServerConfigOptions` to describe the parameters we can adjust about `Zeta Engine` config (config in SeaTunnel.yaml). 

The benefits:
- We can easily know what parameter can be adjusted, that can help us to tune the performance.   
- When version release, we can easily know which parameter has been changed, which can break the user version upgrade, which is added in new version, So we can record this into version upgrade document (although we don't have it yet).  


2. refactor connector, implement `TableSourceFactory`, `TableSinkFactory` interface and implement `createSource`, `createSink`, `optionRule` method.

In `optionRule` method, describe which parameter is necessary, which is optional, which are the conflicts with other parameter.  (need action1 done)

Move the connector creation logic from `Connector` to `ConnectorFactory`.


The benefits:
- Know the relationship between parameters. Use the `optionRule` check the config before create connector instance.
- This can be used in SeaTunnelWeb.

issueDTO.title: Use tagify SCSS file for styling of tag inputs
issueDTO.description:
### Description
We currently include the default layout of [tagify](https://github.com/yairEO/tagify/) by copying the original CSS file from the npm package [in gulp](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-server/blob/1acd2ff884e176aa2434d5527fd05f4eb7ecd717/gulpfile.ts#L136). However, the tagify package also provides a [source SCSS file](https://github.com/yairEO/tagify/blob/v4.22.2/src/tagify.scss). It would be interesting to use the SCSS file instead and adapt the styling to our new website design.

### Proposed Solution
1. Use tagifies' SCSS file as a modifiable base instead of the pre-built CSS file
1. Update the styling to match our new website design.

### Benefits
- Consistent styling with our website design.
- Easier maintenance and customization using SCSS.

### Implementation Steps
1. Create a new SCSS file, which included the tagify SCSS file.
1. Use that SCSS file instead of the CSS file in Gulp, so it's copied to `css/dist/tagify.css` during build
1. Update the styling as needed.

### Additional Notes
- Ensure compatibility with other components and styles in our project.

issueDTO.title: Borderless `st.table`
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

Allow creating a `st.table` without any border (also between cells). 

### Why?

This can be a great tool to show data in a condensed format without doing any crazy Markdown or layout hacks. E.g. something like this:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c57ce22c-b91e-4a5c-822c-efdcb3ed065c)

### How?

Add `border=True|False` (defaulting to True) to `st.table`. If set to `False`, all borders should be invisible. 

### Additional Context

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Lasso/box selection switching and usage over existing layers
issueDTO.description:
We want to update dragging and selection such that:
- Ctrl+drag's lasso selection, upon releasing Ctrl, switches to a regular box selection, and back to lasso by holding Ctrl again. It draws a straight line between the cursor position last time the lasso was removed and when it's now restored, allowing the user to also use this as a technique for drawing straight line sections of the lasso, but also just to decide to use box selection instead of lasso at any time.
- Ctrl+dragging an *object* currently drags its layer(s) but we want to make it instead always lasso select. This lets the user perform a lasso selection over an existing layer, or a box selection but releasing Ctrl as in the previous bullet point.
- Lasso selection has a bug that should be fixed: aborting the lasso selection (RMB or Esc) then creating a new lasso selection ends up erroneously extending the previously drawn lasso path because abort fails to clear the lasso data (which also wastes memory!). (#2792)
comments:
opened https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2792 to address the last issue mentioned:
> Lasso selection has a bug that should be fixed: aborting the lasso selection (RMB or Esc) then creating a new lasso selection ends up erroneously extending the previously drawn lasso path because abort fails to clear the lasso data (which also wastes memory!).

opened https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2799 to address the second issue mentioned:
> Ctrl+dragging an object currently drags its layer(s) but we want to make it instead always lasso select. This lets the user perform a lasso selection over an existing layer, or a box selection but releasing Ctrl as in the previous bullet point.

if this change is too much / isn't preferred there is an alternative simpler change: https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2798  . This one felt kind of brittle, needing to sprinkle `!lasso_select` conditions in multiple places, so it lead me to try to refactor and create the first PR.

repository.description: 2D vector & raster editor that melds traditional layers & tools with a modern node-based, non-destructive, procedural workflow.
repository.name: Graphite

summary.main: The issue is about updating the dragging and selection behavior to allow for lasso selection switching and usage over existing layers. This includes fixing a bug where aborting the lasso selection and then creating a new one extends the previously drawn lasso path.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the lasso selection to correctly switch to box selection when the Ctrl key is released, and for Ctrl+dragging an object to always use lasso selection instead of dragging layers. The lasso selection should also correctly clear the lasso data when aborting the selection.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix for the first issue can be implemented by updating the dragging and selection logic to switch between lasso and box selection when the Ctrl key is released. For the second issue, the fix involves updating the Ctrl+dragging behavior to always use lasso selection instead of dragging layers. The third issue can be fixed by clearing the lasso data when aborting the lasso selection.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'Good First Issue' and 'Paper Cut', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after screenshots or video if possible.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Adding Randomized Algorithms to the Repository
issueDTO.description:
### What would you like to Propose?

Hello everyone,

Until just five days ago, our repository had very few randomized algorithms. If anyone is motivated, they can dive into the topic and implement some interesting randomized algorithms.




### Issue details

As examples, i could consider algorithms like:

- [ ] Randomized Closest Pair Algorithm

- [x] Randomized Quicksort [solved by @VibhuKhera123 #6234 ] 

- [ ] Randomized Matrix Multiplication Verification, if A* B = C

And many others...

### Additional Information


These algorithms are a bit harder to test due to their inherent randomness, but they offer a great opportunity to expand the variety of algorithms in the repository and explore different problem-solving approaches.

If you're interested, feel free to start exploring and contribute! Any contributions would be highly appreciated.

issueDTO.title: Create Mock Blockchain Services for Testing
comments:
Hi there! 👋

I’d love to work on this “TypeScript mock implementations” task so our frontend & backend teams can develop against the StarkHive contracts before deployment. Here’s my high-level plan:

1. **Interface scaffolding**  
   - Pull the exact `NFTContractInterface`, `JobContractInterface`, etc. from Issues #440 & #441.  
   - Generate TS stubs for each contract method & event signature.

2. **Mock implementations**  
   - For each contract interface, create a `MockXyzContract` class that simulates state in-memory (e.g. `Map<…>`).  
   - Implement all methods with realistic return types, incrementing IDs or toggling states as needed.  
   - Include optional IPFS-style metadata where applicable.

3. **Configurable delays & errors**  
   - Add a shared `MockConfig` where teams can set per-contract or per-method delays (in ms) and error rates.  
   - Wrap methods in a helper that injects `await sleep(config.delay)` and randomly throws when `config.errorRate > 0`.

4. **Dockerized local server**  
   - Spin up an Express (or Fastify) HTTP+JSON-RPC server exposing each mock contract under distinct endpoints (e.g. `/mock/nft/mint`).  
   - Write a `Dockerfile` that installs dependencies, builds TS, and starts the mock server.  
   - Expose ports & volume-mount docs for easy local use.

5. **Documentation & examples**  
   - Add a `README.md` with:
     - Installation via `docker build` + `docker run`
     - Environment variables or JSON config format
     - Sample TS code showing how to `import { MockNFTContract }` or call the Docker-based RPC.  
   - Provide a small `example/` folder with a Next.js or Node script that mints a token, polls for events, and demonstrates error injection.

6. **Testing**  
   - Write unit tests (Jest) to assert that each mock follows its interface and respects delays/errors.  
   - Add a CI step in `mock/` that runs these tests.

I’ll follow the project’s CONTRIBUTING guidelines, commit under a branch named `mock-contracts-setup`, and open a draft PR once I’ve scaffolded the first two mocks. Please assign this issue to me or let me know if there’s any other setup I should follow first. Looking forward to making contract-driven dev a breeze! 🚀

[1]
```yaml

        - containerPort: 8080
          protocol: TCP
  multiModel: false
  supportedModelFormats:
  - autoSelect: true
    name: vLLM

---

    serving.kserve.io/deploymentMode: RawDeployment

        - --model_name=granite-3-2-8b-instruct

      env:
        - name: VLLM_CACHE_ROOT

      resources:

          memory: 24Gi

        requests:
          cpu: '1'
          memory: 8Gi
          nvidia.com/gpu: '1'
      runtime: vllm-runtime
    tolerations:
      - effect: NoSchedule
        key: nvidia.com/gpu
        operator: Exists

```


**What did you expect to happen:**

I would expect it to fail validation and give me an actionable error message.

**What's the InferenceService yaml:**

See above.

**Anything else you would like to add:**

- We need to have a test to validate that the controller doesn't panic in this case and gives the user an actionable and clear error message.

**Environment:**

- Knative Version: 1.16
- KServe Version: 0.15
- Cloud Environment: Any
- Minikube/Kind version: Any
- Kubernetes version: (use `kubectl version`): Any
- OS (e.g. from `/etc/os-release`): Any

issueDTO.title: Fifo limit doesn't consider blob disk usage for key-value separated trees
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
The `Fifo` compaction strategy does not consider the size of the blob storage for key-value separated trees. I think the bug is in [this](https://github.com/fjall-rs/lsm-tree/blob/main/src/compaction/fifo.rs#L72) line. It is calling `levels.size()`, but that doesn't include the size of the blobs. We can see [here](https://github.com/fjall-rs/lsm-tree/blob/main/src/blob_tree/mod.rs#L562) that the `BlobTree::disk_usage()` considers both the size of the index (keys) & blobs (values).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. In the [rolling-log](https://github.com/fjall-rs/fjall/blob/main/examples/rolling-log/src/main.rs) example, enable kv separation & change inserted value to `[0; 1024]`
2. Run the example & watch it crash on the assert after 5 steps.

**Expected behavior**
The partition should be compacted as per the docs.

**Additional context**
I'm using fjall, not this crate directly. But since `Fifo` is defined in this crate, I'm opening this issue here.
comments:
Key value separation avoids rewriting large amounts of data when compacting over and over again, but the FIFO compaction does not really rewrite data as long as your incoming stream is a monotonic series (key is only ascending or descending).
So there's no real advantage to using key value separation with FIFO. Should maybe be documented.

Thanks, makes sense then. Our workload is indeed just storing a stream of data where the key is just a strictly monotonically increasing sequence number: https://github.com/blacksky-algorithms/rsky/pull/119/commits/ea41de09908bb8852e178ca97a8aab5f0e3857c3.
Feel free to close the issue.

repository.description: K.I.S.S. LSM-tree implementation in safe Rust

The issue needs to be addressed by documenting the limitations of the strategy and updating the documentation accordingly.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the FIFO compaction strategy to correctly handle key-value separated trees, considering the size of the blob storage. This requires documentation to accurately reflect the limitations of the strategy.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by documenting the limitations of the FIFO compaction strategy with key-value separation, specifically that it doesn't consider blob disk usage. This documentation should be added to the relevant section of the crate's documentation.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'documentation', 'help wanted', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with the documentation updated to reflect the FIFO compaction strategy's limitations.

issueDTO.title: Download videos from google search
issueDTO.description:
<!--

######################################################################
  WARNING!
  IGNORING THE FOLLOWING TEMPLATE WILL RESULT IN ISSUE CLOSED AS INCOMPLETE
######################################################################

-->


## Checklist

<!--
Carefully read and work through this check list in order to prevent the most common mistakes and misuse of youtube-dl:
- First of, make sure you are using the latest version of youtube-dl. Run `youtube-dl --version` and ensure your version is 2021.12.17. If it's not, see https://yt-dl.org/update on how to update. Issues with outdated version will be REJECTED.
- Search the bugtracker for similar site feature requests: http://yt-dl.org/search-issues. DO NOT post duplicates.
- Finally, put x into all relevant boxes (like this [x])
-->

- [x] I'm reporting a site feature request
- [x] I've verified that I'm running youtube-dl version **2021.12.17**
- [x] I've searched the bugtracker for similar site feature requests including closed ones


## Description

<!--
Provide an explanation of your site feature request in an arbitrary form. Please make sure the description is worded well enough to be understood, see https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl#is-the-description-of-the-issue-itself-sufficient. Provide any additional information, suggested solution and as much context and examples as possible.
-->

With the latest google search versions, one can look up "NFL" (for example), and the schedules, players and teams pop-up as well as (and this is what I'm suggesting to implement) previews or highlights. When trying to download them from the Google page, it does not recognizes it, the user needs to get into the actual video (youtube in most cases) to get it. Implementing this would mean much faster access to videos and the users not having to navigate several layers of webpages to download them.
I tried creating a general "google extractor" but couldn't manage to do it. Other option I thought about but could not put into practice was to handle that webpage forwarding (google search -> youtube) within the program
comments:
You'll need to open the search page with JS disabled to see anything like what yt-dl would see. With any luck, the video page will be the value of a parameter, eg `q`, in the link in the search page.

Some examples of search pages, video links in the pages and the linked videos could help this along.
There is already a google search extractor. It is broken atm, but easy to fix. See https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/commit/c533c89ce1d6965d8575413738d76a5bf9e2de59

Thanks.

First see https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/29724 and the issue linked from it, and the manual, especially the section linked from there.

From the [comment](https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/30576#issuecomment-1026427016), possibly the linked fork has fixed the extractor and you will just need to back-port the change.

Once you have a branch working in your fork, you can make a Pull Request against the yt-dl repo.
how do i back-port the change ? I just search what it mean, should it mean that i should Copy paste the commit and make the PR myself ?
i make a fork myself so I doing to work like that (use the commit of @pukkandan )

One way is to use a tool like [_meld_](https://opensource.com/article/20/3/meld), a graphical difference editor. Check out yt-dl and yt-dlp, load the yt-dlp extractor into the editor and load the yt-dl extractor into the right-hand pane. Then you can go through the differences and decide whether the yt-dlp change should applied directly, modified or ignored. Some changes will be specific to yt-dlp and need to be adapted so as to run on both Python 2 and 3. For example, the linked commit includes these lines that will fail in Python 2 
```
                'http://www.google.com/search', f'gvsearch:{query}',
                note=f'Downloading result page {pagenum + 1}',
```
You'll need to change this in some way, say:
```
                'http://www.google.com/search', 'gvsearch:' + query,
                note='Downloading result page %d' % (pagenum + 1, ),
```

Some IDE plug-in or judicious use of _vi_ and _diff_ could achieve the same result.

If there is a specific change, a commit or set of commits, that should be applied, you can use _git_ magic to apply such commits while preserving the commit details. In GH you can add `.patch` to commit and PR URLs to generate a patch file that you can pass to the `git am` command: to make the patch applicable you first have to edit it to replace the `yt_dlp/` in pathnames with `youtube_dl/`. After applying the patch to your branch you can make any additional changes in your own subsequent commit. Eventually when this gets merged we would probably `squash` the commits in the PR so that the resulting commit appears as `Co-authored by:` all the people whose commits are included.

As above, test the modified extractor in your patch branch (there's a small test in the linked commit). Then push the branch to your yt-dl fork. You should be able to enable the server-side tests that ensure your changes work in a variety of supported environments. Fix any issues and then create a PR against our youtube_dl repo.
Hey,Can I work on this issue
Please do.
Can I work on this issue if no one's on it? @dirkf
Sure. Possibly the "AI"-ification of G search and/or the requirement to have JS for G search now makes this impractical. Let us know.

issueDTO.title: Delegations Dashboard
issueDTO.description:
This suggestion came from WiiMee:

There are several services used for "wallet delegations", such as Delegate.xyz and Warm.xyz. It would be useful to have a "Delegations" tab next to Approvals and Signatures which displays a list of delegations for a wallet with the option to revoke the delegations.

I don't know enough about how these delegations work in particular to know how viable this is, but I think it is definitely a good idea to explore it.
comments:
Delegate.xyz v1 has contract view functions that return lists of given delegations (cold -> hot wallet):
https://etherscan.io/address/0x00000000000076a84fef008cdabe6409d2fe638b#readContract

Delegate.xyz v2 has view functions that return lists of given and received delegations (cold <> hot wallet):
https://etherscan.io/address/0x00000000000000447e69651d841bd8d104bed493#readContract

Warm.xyz has view functions that return a single given delegation or a list of received delegations (cold <> hot wallet):
https://etherscan.io/address/0xc3aa9bc72bd623168860a1e5c6a4530d3d80456c#readProxyContract

So it looks like we can definitely display *given* delegations for all of these platforms with just a few smart contract calls. We should also be able to display *received* delegations for Delegate v2 and Warm easily, but not for Delegate v1. From a security perspective, inspecting / revoking *given* delegations is the important part in any case.

If we wanted full support for given + received delegations and/or if we wanted to display delegations/revokals in a future "History" tab, then we may need to look at Delegation events as well.

My idea around implementation for this would be that we create a "DelegationsPlatform" class similar to the "Chain" class, which can be instantiated with a "name" and a "getter" function. Alternatively we could also create it in a way that looks closer to the PriceStrategy, where each platform gets its own subclass.
Assigning this to @Dozie2001
Tackling this
maybe close this @rkalis  ?

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: extensions.sh fails when no passed function hooks found
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

Recent run of `Build All Artifacts` action [failed](https://github.com/armbian/os/actions/runs/15516597014/attempts/1) at the `Prepare Info JSON and Matrices` step, due to a subshell error 123 while running the `extensions.sh` script:

```
  [💥] Error  123 occurred in SUBSHELL [ SUBSHELL at /home/actions-runner-01/_work/os/os/build/lib/functions/general/extensions.sh:582 ]
  Error:  Error  123 occurred in SUBSHELL SUBSHELL at /home/actions-runner-01/_work/os/os/build/lib/functions/general/extensions.sh:582
```

From what I can see, xargs fails due to grep returning nothing. Not sure why, perhaps there are no passed arguments so there's no `searched_hook_names` to grep?

 https://github.com/armbian/build/blob/c2d1479fa646ad42718d685527beb8815f5498c8/lib/functions/general/extensions.sh#L582

The function is new and was introduced last week:
https://github.com/armbian/build/commit/10570df8048919d15f09ef24b088b3a168793c72

Possible mitigation step is appending ` || true` to the subshell invocation at line 582 so it never fails. If lack of input arguments is indeed the issue, early `enable_extensions_with_hostdeps_builtin_and_user` return is preferable, of course.

### How to reproduce?

https://github.com/armbian/os/actions/runs/15516597014/job/43684884037#annotation:10:80

### Branch

main (main development branch)

### On which host OS are you running the build script and observing this problem?

Ubuntu 24.04 Noble

### Are you building on Windows WSL2?

- [ ] Yes, my Ubuntu/Debian/OtherOS is running on WSL2

### Relevant log URL

_No response_

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
