summary.attemptedFixes: Possible mitigation steps include appending `|| true` to the subshell invocation at line 582 to prevent the script from failing. Another option is to return early from the `enable_extensions_with_hostdeps_builtin_and_user` function if there are no input arguments.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'Bug' and 'Good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with relevant code changes and fixes to resolve the issue.

issueDTO.title: Frontend Proposal creation
issueDTO.description:
# Description

We are working on a front end for a DAO onchain.

Need #505 to be merged and #516 to be fully finish for the indexer and the data-backend

# Scope

apps/mobile project in React native typescript
/screens/DAO
/module/DAO

dao_aa.cairo need to be understand to create the hook to interact with this smart_contract

- [ ] Add hook to create a DAO
- [ ] Create UI with mocked data for a DAO
- [ ] Create DAO card
- [ ] DAO Screen detail: dao contract address, and proposal list
- [ ] Hook to create_proposal
- [ ] Hook to cast_vote
comments:
I’m excited to apply for the opportunity to contribute to the frontend development of your on-chain DAO project. Here’s how I’d approach the tasks outlined in the scope:

o Ensure https://github.com/AFK-AlignedFamKernel/afk_monorepo/issues/505 is merged and https://github.com/AFK-AlignedFamKernel/afk_monorepo/issues/516 is fully completed for the indexer and data-backend.
o Familiarize myself with the dao_aa.cairo smart contract to create the necessary hooks for interaction.
o Develop a custom hook (e.g., useCreateDAO) to interact with the dao_aa.cairo smart contract.
o Handle transaction signing, gas estimation, and error handling for DAO creation.
o Build a responsive and user-friendly UI for DAO creation and management.
o Use mocked data to simulate DAO details, proposals, and voting functionality during development.
o Create a reusable DAOCard component to display key DAO information (e.g., name, description, proposal count).
o Ensure the card is visually appealing and functional across devices.
o Build a detailed DAO screen that displays:
 DAO contract address.
 List of proposals (with status, title, and voting results).
o Add navigation between the DAO list and detail screens.
o Implement a useCreateProposal hook to interact with the smart contract and submit new proposals.
o Include validation and user feedback for proposal creation.
o Develop a useCastVote hook to allow users to vote on proposals.
o Handle transaction signing, gas fees, and voting confirmation.

I have extensive experience building frontend applications with React Native and TypeScript.

issueDTO.title: Better type hints
issueDTO.description:
With @pariterre, we think that we should migrate to global type hints:

currently we have such hints:
```python3
def function(entry: list[int] | tuple[int]):
      return None
```

Instead, we would like:
```python3
ListLikeInt = list[int] | tuple[int]
def function(entry: ListLikeInt):
      return None
```
comments: @Ipuch I got this. You want to change in every python file?

@EastWest14 
With great pleasure 🙂 

Could you first create a PR for a single file with the proposed naming for the all (or most of) the list/tuple (and other typing names that you can think of)? Once we agreed with the naming with @Ipuch , you could change it everywhere. This new file should be misc/types.py

Thanks a lot!
@pariterre @Ipuch Do you want me to continue with PRs for other modules? Happy to keep working on this
Definitely :)

That's a great idea ! Great work by the way ;) 
TBH, I'm curious, how did you find the repo and the issue ?

Ok, there are about 6 big modules - I'll be going one by one. Will take about 2-3 days per module.
Will post PRs as they come up and tag you here.

comments:
Hi,

May I work on this? I am in the process of getting an AutoGluon integration submitted. I would suggest using auto-sklearn [https://automl.github.io/auto-sklearn/master/] instead of scikit-learn since AutoML features are desired.  Or I could suggest it as a new integration? (For the ongoing hackathon :))

What do you mean by "The encoding part should be done by a new library, refactored out of lightwood.".

Best,
Dipti

Hi @f2010126,

Apologies, but I'll be working on this one -partially- to understand better that last question ourselves:

> The encoding part should be done by a new library, refactored out of lightwood.

We want to enable better feature engineering for other ML engines, too, and we think it's feasible to move this component out of lightwood. A prime first use case is for a simple (non-automl) sklearn engine to use it for any non-numerical feature, hence improving its robustness.

Also just FYI, there is an ongoing PR by another community member for auto-sklearn that we hope will be completed soon.

Hi @paxcema,

No issues :) . It would be really cool if you could publish the results of your quest for better feature engineering. The use of ML in large scale applications is a personal interest.
possibly just numpy instead of sklearn
@paxcema should we keep this open?
Let's keep it open, I've added a few tags. May be worth promoting on Slack as a fun (and impactful) project.
I’d like to take on this issue if no one else is working on it.

I apologize for the delay - I had an unexpected emergency situation. I will start working on this by Sunday. Would that timeline work? I have some other pending freelance work to complete as well, but I'll ensure this gets proper attention.Once again, I'm sorry for the delay

issueDTO.title: New common getExampleAlerts() method
issueDTO.description:
This is for all scan rules - active, passive, http, websocket, future ones :)
The method is proposed to be a 'defacto standard' for now: `List<Alert> getExampleAlerts()`

It will be accessed by the [generate_alert_pages.js](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-admin/blob/master/scripts/generate_alert_pages.js) script using introspection. This script generates the https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/ pages.

At the moment the script can only cope with one alert per add-on, while many addons generate several.

Ease of maintenance is key - this new method should call any suitable existing methods - if they don't exist the new ones could be created.

Release & beta rules with little to no info which should implement this new method asap:

- [x] https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/10003/ Vulnerable JS Library
- [x] https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/10020/ X-Frame-Options Header
- [x] https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/10032/ Viewstate

The plan is to only expose the information currently on the alert pages, so URLs can be https://www.example.com

Any new generic text created for these alerts should be i18n'd

## Description 📹

Loom : https://www.loom.com/share/6496af3229144f6da4503eece78839b3

**There is a bug preventing me from verifying my GitHub account identity. I can restart this process in an infinite loop, and I don't know if my GitHub account is verified. There is no 'done' check icon.**

## Proposed Actions 🛠️

Here’s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   ```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
   ```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
	[Insert Code snippet if needed with a mardown todo list]

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   ```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: [Short description of the fix]"
   ```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren’t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing `Close #[issue_id]`.
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

⚠️ WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: Query on Inconsistent Session Time Display
issueDTO.description: 原因も再現性も仕様なのかもよく分からないのですがとりあえず報告させていただきます。 #### **Description** Hello, I've observed an inconsistency between the session time displayed in the Claude Code extension UI and the time shown by the `ccusage` command-line tool, and I would like to ask if this is the intended behavior. Currently, the extension UI indicates the session resets at 6 PM, which is the actual time the session ends. However, the `ccusage blocks --live` monitor in the terminal shows the session ending at a different time (8 PM in the attached screenshot). This difference can be a bit confusing as it's not clear which timer to follow. Could you please clarify if this is the expected behavior? #### **Steps to Observe the Behavior** 1. On macOS with the latest version of VS Code. 2. Have the Claude Code extension installed. 3. In the VS Code integrated terminal, run the command `ccusage@latest blocks --live`. 4. The time displayed by the extension in the editor's top bar ("resets at 6pm") differs from the "Remaining" time in the `ccusage` monitor (e.g., shows end time of 8:00:00 PM). #### **My Expectation** For clarity, I would expect both timers to be synchronized and reflect the actual session end time. #### **Screenshots** As shown in the screenshot, the top right of the IDE indicates a reset time of 6 PM, while the `ccusage` session monitor in the terminal shows a session end time of 8 PM. #### **Environment** * **OS:** macOS * **IDE:** Visual Studio Code (Latest Version) * **Tool:** `ccusage@latest` * **Extension Name & Version:** Claude Code `[Please add extension version if known]` Thank you for looking into this.

issueDTO.title: Tracking Issue: New nodes
issueDTO.description:
Status of this issue: all of this needs to be reviewed and revised. Consider this list to be more of "inspiration" than a todo list, until we can rework it in its entirety to create an actual todo list.

---

This is a living, growing list. It's not organized and isn't ready-to-grab-from— please ask in Discord if you'd like to begin adding nodes or have an interest in certain ones, since they will probably need some discussion and some may be blocked on current technical limitations. But this does list a lot of opportunities for interesting contributions.

Documentation for making new nodes: https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/blob/master/node-graph/README.md

### Noise
- [x] Pixel Noise
- [x] Perlin and/or Simplex Noise (#1517)
- [x] Voronoi Noise (#1517)

### Image Dimensions
- [ ] Crop based on margin
- [ ] Crop based on top left offset and desired dimensions
- [ ] Resize based on scale factor (user to choose interpolation method)
- [ ] Resize based on desired resolution (user to choose interpolation method)
- [ ] Tile to fill bounds
- [ ] Get image dimensions (returns vec2)

### Image transformations
- [ ] Flip (choose horizontal or vertical)
- [ ] Rotate (choose interpolation method and negative space fill)
- [ ] Shift image (choose X, Y and negative space fill)

### Image channels
- [x] #1169
- [x] Extract Alpha
- [x] Extract Opaque

### Image adjustments
- [x] Brightness/Contrast
- [x] Levels
- [ ] Curves - *requires custom widget*
- [x] Exposure
- [x] Vibrance - *still needs a Saturation slider*
- [x] Hue/Saturation - *current algorithm is incorrect*
- [ ] Color Balance
- [x] Black & White - *rename from Grayscale*
- [ ] Photo Filter
- [x] Channel Mixer
- [ ] Color Lookup
- [x] Invert RGB
- [x] Posterize
- [x] Threshold
- [x] Selective Color
- [x] Gradient Map

### Other adjustments
- [x] Gamma

comments: A good resource for nodes (vulkan compute shaders) useful in photo editing can be found in [vkdt](https://github.com/hanatos/vkdt/tree/master/src/pipe/modules). Also Aurelien's [blog](https://eng.aurelienpierre.com/2021/02/image-processing-does-not-kill-people-and-its-a-shame/#do-the-right-thing-the-right-way-at-the-right-time) has quite a few gems (if you don't mind his language) @Keavon
Neat, thanks for the resources!

~Is there a node that combines scalars to vectors?
Maybe im missing something but seems pretty essential for me. Of course Chnging the vector2 value node to accept f64 as input would suffice.~
Just learnd from the documentation for adding new nodes that the properties can be inputs. For me it wasn't intuitive
enough to click on the tiny dots.

repository.description: 2D vector & raster editor that melds traditional layers & tools with a modern node-based, non-destructive, procedural workflow.
repository.name: Graphite

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to implement new nodes in the Graphite Editor, which will enhance its functionality and provide more options for users. The nodes will allow for more advanced image processing, vector operations, and other features that will make the editor more powerful and versatile.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the nodes to be implemented correctly, following the documentation for adding new nodes, which includes information on properties, inputs, and outputs. The nodes should be tested thoroughly to ensure they work as expected, and the issue should be closed once all the nodes are implemented and tested.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by reviewing and revising the list of nodes, which is currently unorganized and not ready-to-grab-from. The list includes various nodes for noise, image dimensions, image transformations, image channels, image adjustments, filters, vector operations, and more. Contributors can start by implementing some of these nodes, which will help to rework the list into an actual todo list.
summary.otherNotes: This is a tracking issue for new nodes in the Graphite Editor, a 2D vector & raster editor that melds traditional layers & tools with a modern node-based, non-destructive, procedural workflow. The issue is currently labeled as 'Good First Issue', 'Graphene', and 'Help Wanted', indicating it's a suitable task for a contributor to tackle. The issue has been open for a while and has several comments and labels, indicating a good starting point for contributors.

issueDTO.title: Add streaming support to vtkF3DSplatReader
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
F3D support reading splat, however this reader does not support streaming yet. We will need all reader to support streaming in the future, lets add it!

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Add an Streaming API to vtkF3DSplatReader by inheriting from vtkAbstractPolyDataReader
 - Implement that API in a similar way has the implement in vtkF3DSPZReader
 - Add test similar to TestF3DSPZReader
comments: Hello, can I work on this?

Of course! You may want to join our discord to discuss this though.

https://discord.f3d.app

> Of course! You may want to join our discord to discuss this though.
> 
> https://discord.f3d.app

You're away/not active in discord, how much will be this bounty?
I answered you on discord. The bounty system is not active.
@BenraouaneSoufiane I suppose that you are not interested to contribute to this without a bounty ?

> [@BenraouaneSoufiane](https://github.com/BenraouaneSoufiane) I suppose that you are not interested to contribute to this without a bounty ?

Yes

Hi!
I’d like to work on this issue. Could you please assign it to me?

> Hi! I’d like to work on this issue. Could you please assign it to me?

Of course! Do not hesitate to join the discord. Please note the bounty system is not live yet.

https://discord.f3d.app

repository.description: Fast and minimalist 3D viewer.
repository.name: f3d

summary.main: The issue is about adding streaming support to vtkF3DSplatReader, a feature that is currently missing. This will enable the reader to handle large datasets more efficiently and improve overall performance.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for vtkF3DSplatReader to support streaming, allowing for efficient and continuous data processing. This feature is necessary for future development and should be implemented to maintain compatibility with other readers.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by inheriting from vtkAbstractPolyDataReader, implementing the Streaming API, and adding tests similar to TestF3DSPZReader. The contributor may also want to discuss this issue on the project's Discord channel.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'help wanted' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with a detailed description of the changes made to add streaming support to vtkF3DSplatReader.
